1.title: Constance Baker Motley: Judiciary’s Unsung Rights Hero
1.subtitle: Constance Baker Motley was an unlikely civil rights hero. An African American who grew up near Yale University, she did not personally experience overt racism until late in high school, and as a young person she was almost totally unaware of black history.

1.title: I Wear African
1.subtitle: I Wear African is a campaign initiative created to promote and celebrate the contemporary African lifestyle by bringing the best quality Afrocentric brands to our fans.

products.name: Hector Rectangular Indoor Lumbar Pillow
products.description: Artfully inspiring and beautiful, the Lumbar Pillow bolsters your home instantly and effortlessly while evoking bohemian style. Made in the USA, the classic rectangular silhouette of the pillow is filled with a feather down insert and is covered with a quality linen blend fabric.

products.name: African Print Dashiki T-Shirt White
products.description: The D’iyanu white dashiki t-shirt is perfect for those hot summer days! Stay cool and look great with this dashiki t-shirt which features an ultra soft feel and unique center front and sleeve details. This will become an instant favorite in your closet, and one of your most worn shirts in the hot summer!

products.name: Women African Print Yellow Long Puff Sleeve Dress
products.description: Handmade, 100% cotton, Afronista dress. Available in sizes 2-14.

2.title: Black Lives Matter
2.subtitle: We appreciate your support of the movement and our ongoing fight to end state-sanctioned violence, liberate Black people, and end white supremacy forever.

2.title: What I am learning from my white grandchildren
2.subtitle: Are we in a post-racial society? Do we want to be? Anthony Peterson, an African American, draws from current research and from conversations with his Anglo American grandchildren to address truths about race in 21st century America.

3.title: As I Am
3.subtitle: As I Am hair is a natural hair care brand. It markets unique and exclusively formulated hair products. It consists of 11 products designed for tightly coiled hair made from the finest organic ingredients. The line then became a quick success.

products.name: Coconut CoWash 16 oz
products.description: You already know it and your hair can feel it! CoWashing is the way to cleanse your hair most of the time. This light no-suds conditioning cream gently removes residue including all of the things you've used to style and maintain your coils and curls. Now it's time for a sparkling new beginning.

products.name: Coils & Curls Care Package
products.description: Experience the superb performance of As I Am® products with this economical starter set. Designed to nurture and style the texture that’s naturally yours.

products.name: Moisturizing Hand Sanitizer
products.description: Kills 99.99% Of All Common Germs. Eliminates Bacteria On Skin. Anti Microbial. Contains 62% Ethyl Alcohol. Fragrance Free. Unscented. Enriched with Aloe Vera, Betaine, and Glycerin. 73% Increase in Skin Hydration. This Gentle formula Improves Skin Health by 41%

3.title: How to deconstruct racism, one headline at a time
3.subtitle: Baratunde Thurston explores the phenomenon of white Americans calling the police on black Americans who have committed the crimes of ... eating, walking or generally "living while black." In this profound, thought-provoking and often hilarious talk, he reveals the power of language to change stories of trauma into stories of healing — while challenging us all to level up.

4.title: Frederick Douglass
4.subtitle: Frederick Douglass was an escaped slave who became a prominent activist, author and public speaker.

4.title: Post 21
4.subtitle: Post 21 was created by a Mother-Daughter duo who wanted a comprehensive marketplace that focused on products from Black-owned businesses. They felt strongly that there’s no reason why these products are consistently being discovered when they should be household names. So, they said let’s create the place we want to shop.

products.name: Ball is Life Dog Tag
products.description: Super cool, fun, and durable Pet ID Tags. There's a tag for you and your pet's personality! Comes with custom engraving, to make sure that your little one is never lost and can always find it's way home.

products.name: B is for Black Boy
products.description: B is for Black Boy was written to celebrate the awe-inspiring nature of the Black male. It speaks life into our Black boys and empowers them to manifest their highest potential. It's intended to author and assert positive representation of Black boys to all audiences.

products.name: Headband
products.description: Handmade upcycled padded headband, with satin ribbon on underside next to hair.

5.title: Feed Love
5.subtitle: Our mission is to create a culture, through quality apparel, where seeing, being and feeding love, can change the world.

5.title: Official Black Wall Street

6.title: YTPshop - African Clothing
6.subtitle: All YTPshop products are crafted by women in Nigeria and the fabrics are carefully sourced from West African markets. YTPshop products are made with high-quality material, cutting edge tailoring, vibrant colors, and are affordably priced.

6.title: Sade Baron
6.subtitle: Sade and Rachel are a mother-daughter duo creating high-performance body care products that make your skin feel great. As a 100% woman-owned business, they select every ingredient in their products. Everything is handmade, carefully packaged, and personally checked for impeccable quality.

products.name: Body Care Set 1 - Normal Skin
products.description: The essentials kit features everything you need to keep maintain your skin health. Start with a new skinfood routine and feed it nutrient-rich superfoods all day, every day.

products.name: Go Clean Starter Kit | Body Care Set
products.description: With this Go Clean Body Care Starter Set you can finally remove excessive ingredients and chemicals from your daily body care routine. With Sade Baron, all of our products are 100% vegan, made with clean ingredients to work for most skin types, so you can trust that you'll find great products to work for you.

products.name: Fragrance Free Body Wash
products.description: A light face and body wash suitable for everyday use. This fragrance-free body wash is perfect for babies, children and adults with reactive and sensitive skin. With superfats galore like avocado oil, olive oil and more, this liquid castile soap will leave your skin hydrated day after day.

7.title: Color blind or color brave?
7.subtitle: The subject of race can be very touchy. As finance executive Mellody Hobson says, it's a "conversational third rail." But, she says, that's exactly why we need to start talking about it. In this engaging, persuasive talk, Hobson makes the case that speaking openly about race — and particularly about diversity in hiring — makes for better businesses and a better society.

7.title: Amazing Essence
7.subtitle: Amazing Essence is a Philadelphia based, one-woman small business built on a dream of entrepreneurship. Our handcrafted products are created using 100% soy wax without additives, natural (lead-free) cotton wick and high quality fragrance oils without phthalates or additives.

products.name: 25 oz. Triple Wick Candle Bowl
products.description: The Amazing Essence 25 oz. candle bowls are handcrafted using natural soy wax, high quality fragrance oils without phthalates and a natural cotton wick to ensure a clean, toxic-free burn in your home or office.

products.name: 4oz. Linen Spray
products.description: Mist our handcrafted linen sprays into the air liberally to Relax, Balance or Uplift your senses. When misting Linen, Spray 7 inches away and only on washable fabric. Contains essential oils/highly quality fragrance oils.

products.name: 8oz. Herbal Candles
products.description: The Amazing Essence 8 oz. herbal candles are handcrafted using natural soy wax, and fused with dried herbs, high quality fragrance oils without phthalates and a natural cotton wick to ensure a clean, toxic-free burn in your home or office. Approx 40hr of burn time.

8.title: 15th Amendment
8.subtitle: The 15th Amendment granting African-American men the right to vote was adopted into the U.S. Constitution in 1870.

8.title: Aloha Glamour
8.subtitle:
Aloha Glamour is a lifestyle movement that promotes women loving themselves wholeheartedly. We are a community of women that empower others to use find and use their voice to turn their tragedies into triumphs and their mess into a message which enables them to build from the inside out...seeing and LIVING in color again. 

Thanks to our inspiring collections and our impeccable customer service, we have been highly successful since day one. Browse through our site and check out the latest additions to our collection, and feel free to get in touch with our team if you need any assistance.

We want you to create a story in each and every Aloha Glamour piece that you wear. What's the color of your story?

9.title: Mutt's Sauce
9.subtitle: In 1956, Mutt got the idea to make a sauce he could use for every meal. Mutt’s sauce was a multi-purpose specialty sauce, infusing sweet, tangy and a little bit of heat into each spoonful.

products.name: Combo 3 Pack
products.description: BEST VALUE! Try all three: Original, Sweet N Spicy, Ghost Pepper

products.name: Jerk seasoning

10.title: Justice for Dominique Fells
10.subtitle: June 9th, another black trans woman named Dominique Fells was murdered and thrown in a river. The violence against black trans women needs to stop. We cannot allow for the murder of this young woman to go unpunished.

products.name: My Beauty Secret is Gratitude
products.description: You've now found the staple t-shirt of your wardrobe. It's made of a thicker, heavier cotton, but it's still soft and comfy. And the double stitching on the neckline and sleeves add more durability to what is sure to be a favorite!

11.subtitle: We're on a mission to make wellness easy, accessible and fun for all. To us, self-care means feeling like your best self. We believe that being well should feel good. That means products that fit seamlessly into your lifestyle, not the other way around.

12.subtitle: Revisionist History is a podcast from Malcolm Gladwell and Pushkin Industries.In this episode: A landmark Supreme Court case. A civil rights revolution. Why has everyone forgotten what happened next?

12.title: Timeline of investigation into Tyre Nichols' death should be the "blueprint"
12.subtitle: Civil rights attorney Ben Crump says the investigation and action Memphis took in the wake of the death of Tyre Nichols should be how all cases involving police brutality are handled.

13.title: Whistling Vivaldi
13.subtitle: Claude M. Steele, who has been called "one of the few great social psychologists," offers a vivid first-person account of the research that supports his groundbreaking conclusions on stereotypes and identity.

13.title: Princess Planet
13.subtitle: Princess Planet is a brand of children's entertainment that helps promote characters with diverse hair textures, skin tones, and cultural backgrounds.

products.name: An Octet of Odes – Volume 1
products.description: An Octet of Odes Volume One is a compilation of poems that premiers eight unique characters from Princess Planet. Each character is imagined with both magic and realism. They are created in a world that is as scientific as it is colorful, adventurous, and fun. All of the princesses’ stories are rooted in the realities of geography and history. They all reflect a love of learning and an appreciation for language, diversity, and culture.

products.name: An Octet of Odes – Volume 2
products.description: An Octet of Odes Volume Two is a compilation of poems that premiers eight unique characters from Princess Planet. Each character is imagined with both magic and realism. They are created in a world that is as scientific as it is colorful, adventurous, and fun.

They all reflect a love of learning and an appreciation for language, diversity, and culture.

16.title: Jackie Robinson's Effect on the Negro Leagues & MLB | 'Field of Dreams...Deferred'
16.subtitle: Things actually got tougher for Black baseball players after Jackie Robinson broke the color barrier, as MLB teams followed racist quotas and the Negro Leagues died out. "Many talented Black players got phased out."

17.title: Open Yale Courses: African American History: From Emancipation to the Present
17.subtitle: The purpose of this course is to examine the African American experience in the United States from 1863 to the present. Prominent themes include the end of the Civil War and the beginning of Reconstruction; African Americans’ urbanization experiences; the development of the modern civil rights movement and its aftermath; and the thought and leadership of Booker T. Washington, Ida B. Wells-Barnett, W.E.B. Du Bois, Marcus Garvey, Martin Luther King Jr., and Malcolm X.

17.title: Sorella
17.subtitle: Sorella was founded by two Boss Babes, Heather Sanders & Brittney Turner in 2012. We were 20 years old with no fashion background or training but a lot of hustle and drive! Starting with an inventory of 10 products and packing packages on the floor of our apartment, we never imagined how far we would get!

19.title: Afro Flow Yoga
19.subtitle:
With over 14 years of experience, Leslie Salmon Jones continues to pursue an active interdisciplinary career in health and dance in Boston and New York City. A Toronto native, Leslie received her B.A. in Dance and Health Studies at the State University of New York, and her Fitness Instructors Certification at New York University. She was a scholarship recipient at the esteemed Alvin Ailey Dance Theatre in New York City as well as the London Contemporary Dance School.

As a professional dancer, Leslie worked with known greats such as Judith Jameson, Bill T. Jones and Wynton Marsalis. At her studio in New York, she developed her own exercise program based on various techniques honed through working with her personal training clientele on a daily basis. Today she continues to divide her time between New York City and Boston.

Leslie has extensive experience in the fitness industry, including being a consultant for the New York Knicks healthy lifestyle clinic that teaches self-esteem to youth. She also served as a board member for the organization, Free Arts for Abused Kids, NYC. Today, she serves as a board member of the United Nations Association of New York

20.title: Children's Books Starring Kids of Color
20.subtitle: Jambo Books is a children's book subscription company.  We send our members 2 or 3 books each month that feature a child of color as the star of a fiction story.
20.moreInfo:
Jambo Books serves children from birth to age 13. Our oldest members, ages 10-13, receive a middle grade novel and a nonfiction companion book that expands on a topic discussed in the novel. We focus on stories about children of color to delight your young readers and reaffirm your values of creating an inclusive and welcoming community.

Jambo means “Hello” in Swahili. Hello is an invitation to start a connection, to learn something new, to expand our notion of what it is to be human. Similarly, we invite our readers to build their own empathy muscles by reading about people who aren't exactly like themselves. Together, we affirm the humanity of every person.

20.title: Shades of My Melanin LLC
20.subtitle: At Shades of My Melanin, our goal is to not only offer products that make you feel beautiful in your own skin but to offer products that tell a story for each and every person who wears them. We offer fun, colorful, and creative products that can be worn by all ages.

21.title: Plum Good
21.subtitle: Plum Good locally produces, discriminately sources and proudly brings to market the highest quality culinary and restorative spices, herbs and tea blends available. Our mission is to help bring flavorful nutrition available to our customers.  We make All Natural rubs and blends, teas, jams and sauces.

products.name: Paprika Lime Blend

21.title: Dawoud Bey: The Birmingham Project
21.subtitle: In 2005 American photographer Dawoud Bey visited Birmingham, Alabama, to explore the possibility of making work that would commemorate the September 15, 1963, bombing of the 16th Street Baptist Church. The Birmingham Project, a series that includes photographic diptychs and a split-screen video, is Bey’s powerful response.

22.title: NSPRE Electronics
22.subtitle: The NSPRE™ brand is built on and strives for creativity and culture. We create exciting, lifestyle, and innovative products that inspire everyday use. Our vision is to "Inspire the culture through social technology" to improve others' lifestyles and the way we access the world around us.

products.name: Lynx Bluetooth® Sunglasses
products.description: No earplugs or ear coverings. Open concept sound with privacy. Designed with Ultra Modern materials and a lightweight frame design. Connects to any mobile device with Bluetooth® ability.

products.name: NX Pro Plus LE (128G)
products.description: The (Limited Edition) NSPRE™ NX Pro Plus Cotton Candy is an extension of the original NX Pro. It is 6.5 Inches, has a much slimmer frame of 8.0mm, and 3D curved glass back finish.

products.name: NSPRE™ MicroSDHC - 128GB
products.description: Record and transfer videos, photos, music, files and more from Micro SD enabled host devices such as Android smartphones and tablets, action and surveillance cameras, drones, computers and more.

22.title: Support the King Center
22.subtitle: The King Center remain committed to proactively educating and training individuals and leaders across all sectors in Nonviolence365 to influence equitable change in our national and global infrastructure.

23.title: Bessie Smith, The Empress of the Blues
23.subtitle: She was big and brown and built high off the ground — "a hell of a woman," men called her, but most women said she was "rough." And while there were other blues singers in the first half of the 20th century — some who shared her surname — none could be mistaken for Bessie Smith.

23.title: The Honey Pot Company
23.subtitle: Stay clean, fresh, and balanced, even during your period with our natural menstrual products. Banish bacteria and cramps with herbal-infused, chemical-free sanitary pads and tampons that create a "cooling" effect that’s both protective and soothing.

products.name: Menstrual Cup
products.description: If tampons or pads aren't your "cup" of tea, reach for the Honey Pot Co Menstrual Cup: a convenient, sustainable alternative that's good for you and the earth.

products.name: Mommy-to-Be Wash
products.description: Use our feminine hygiene wash during pregnancy to balance your pH, fight odor-causing bacteria, and calm discomfort while gently cleansing your honeypot.

products.name: Soothing Body Balm
products.description: This body salve is infused with natural magnesium for menstrual cramps and 500 mg of broad-spectrum hemp distillate. This hemp and magnesium body balm does not contain THC.

24.title: The RACE Method Of Talking To A Racism Skeptic
24.subtitle: The RACE Method is an approach that anti-racism allies can take to trying to share their perspective with people who are skeptical that racism against people of color is a problem worthy of specific attention. It is based on principles from non-violent communication and on findings from the science of persuasion.

24.title: Book: Understanding Mass Incarceration
24.subtitle: A People's Guide to the Key Civil Rights Struggle of Our Time

25.title: Book: Tell Me Who You Are
25.subtitle: A roadmap for cultivation racial literacy by Winona Guo and Priya Vulchi

25.title: Ban or Restrict Tear Gas
25.subtitle: The use of tear gas has been banned and is illegal in war. This same tear gas is used by the law enforcement, to control unarmed crowds protesting for the BLM movement. Tear gas is also used for border control and is thrown at innocent migrants who are unarmed and pose no sudden threat to anyone in the vicinity.

26.title: Sweet Pea Books Inc
26.subtitle: Sweet Pea Books is dedicated to producing multicultural books that expose, inspire, amuse, and foster a love of reading in all children. Sweet Pea Books aims to promote the development of good character by teaching values through literature as well as expose young readers to different cultures.

products.name: D Is For Dragon Fruit (Hardcover)
products.description: D is for Dragon Fruit is a vibrantly illustrated, exotic fruit alphabet book that exposes children to a variety of nutritious fruits, reinforces the alphabet and expands a child’s knowledge of the world.

products.name: When Mama Braids My Hair (Hardcover)
products.description: When Mama Braids My Hair captures a young girl’s experience of having her hair braided and the bond it creates with her mother. The tradition of African hair braiding is more than just a Sunday routine. Come join Nikki on an adventure as she is transformed into an Egyptian queen, a Nigerian goddess, a Zulu warrior, and a Maasai girl.

products.name: Elephants Don't Have Stripes! (COMING SOON!)
products.description: Elephants Don’t Have Stripes! Deep in the valley, in the dry grasslands of the African savanna, a young elephant admires other animals for their beauty. He yearns to look and act more like them. One by one, each wish comes true and the young elephant couldn’t be happier.

26.title: Learn about Julius Jones
26.subtitle: Listen to the Jason Flom & Kim Kardashian West talk about Julius Jones’ story.

27.title: The Black Family in the Age of Mass Incarceration
27.subtitle: By author Ta-Nehisi Coates: Fifty years after Daniel Patrick Moynihan’s report “The Negro Family” tragically helped create this system, it's time to reclaim his original intent.

27.title: How to overcome our biases? Walk boldly toward them
27.subtitle: Our biases can be dangerous, even deadly — as we've seen in the cases of Michael Brown in Ferguson, Missouri, and Eric Garner, in Staten Island, New York. Diversity advocate Vernā Myers looks closely at some of the subconscious attitudes we hold toward out-groups. She makes a plea to all people: Acknowledge your biases.

28.title: A.O. Hamer
28.subtitle:
Hey, I'm Aramis and I love color!

My acrylic paintings are inspired by divine femininity, music, higher consciousness, and the cosmos. Liberation is my life's work- to free myself from the chains that could hold me back mentally, physically, and spiritually. My paintbrush reminds me of the creative power I have within the canvas - and life. As I take this journey to freedom, I hope to inspire others along the way.

28.title: How Negro History Week Became Black History Month and Why It Matters Now
28.subtitle: Black History Month has been celebrated in the United States for close to 100 years. But what is it, exactly, and how did it begin?

29.title: Can the Beauty Industry Confront Colorism?
29.subtitle: The beauty industry has been trying to productively confront racism. Can it do the same with colorism, where lighter-skinned models are favored over those with darker skin?

29.title: Gifts for the Spirit
29.subtitle: An independently run, spiritually driven, boutique for the soul

products.name: Melanated Classic Tarot
products.description: Various races and nationalities practice tarot for healing and education, but it's hard to heal and learn with tools that don't represent you. This deck is a solution to that problem.

products.name: Bel Meditation Candle Set
products.description: The BEL uses fire, gravity, and sound to measure time. When the candle is lit, wax melts and eventually a pin falls, landing with a resonant ding - a beautiful way to end your meditation.

products.name: Small Garnierite Palm Stone
products.description: Known as the stone of the Goddess Gaia, GARNIERITE (also called Green Moonstone), is a rare form of Moonstone used for emotional healing, balance, and freedom.

30.title: glAze
30.subtitle: glAze represents those that don't believe it takes much to create an amazing look. We are the stealthy, the un-gawdy, enjoy pale hues and monochromatic splendor yet can switch it up and get really BOLD!

30.title: Uncivil Podcast
30.subtitle: Uncivil brings you stories that were left out of the official history of the Civil War, ransacks America's past, and takes on the history you grew up with. We bring you untold stories about resistance, covert operations, corruption, mutiny, counterfeiting, antebellum drones, and so much more.

31.title: Designs by Tee LLC
31.subtitle: Brooklyn Social Worker designing positive t-shirts and apparel. Supporting homeless children and families in NYC.

31.title: Hoodietowel
31.subtitle: Super soft, absorbent microfiber towel. Sized just right for optimal flexibility 100% cotton. Machine wash. Imported
